mods.note: ) BRITISH CONSULATE MUSCAT PILE NO: 6/29 NAME OF FILE: FOREIGN INTERESTS: RELATIONS BETWEEN NAJD AND TRANSJORDANIA co V£> VX)VI FOREIGN INTERESTS G. SAUDI ARABIA (3) Relations between Najd and Transjourdannia From To Previous Number*COPY. A) Wo. 158_. (97S/37S/45) I British Legation, Jedda. S6th Usv 1936. Sir, With reference to my telegran i$o.' 7 2 of today’s date and to my printed despatch Wo.157 also of today’s date enclosing a record of my conversation with tfheykh lusuf Yasin on May:.23rd regarding the ‘frans-Jordan Wejd frontier, 1 have the honour to reoort further on the statement which the Sheykh made to me at the end of that conversation ahout the new administration arrangements adooted hy the Saudi Arah Oovernraent. 2. Sheykh v usuf said that it had been decided to divide the whole area along the northern frontier of Saudi Arabia into three sections, each under an Inspector. 'he first would extend from the -Persian Gulf to Hafr A1 Batn and the insoector would be respon sible to the Governor of Hasa, The second would extend from Hafr A1 Batn to Jebel Aneza and would be under the Governor of Hail. In both of these cases the ultimate authority would be the King or the Heir Apparent (the latter presumably, though Sheykh Yusuf did not say so, in the King’s absence from Wejd). The third inspector ate would extend from Jebel Aneza to the Gulf of Aqaba. ■^Tie Inspector would be Sheykh Abdul Aziz ibn Seyd, who would be under the Viceroy of the H e jaz. Sheykh Abdul Aziz would reside at qarivyat and would be leaving here to take up his new duties within a ^ew davs. he would have wide powers and would conduct all correspondence with Ma^or QWbb.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 6/29 Foreign Interests: Relations between Najd and Transjordania'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of a copy of an extract from a letter that was composed by the British Legation in Jeddah regarding relations between Nejd [Saudi Arabia] and Trans-Jordania [the Emirate of Trans-Jordan].
